intro: Xylobium crassifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf xylobium, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its large, waxy leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. The fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
